title: travelodge digger driver liverpool edge lane john
story: The workman was filmed trashing the Edge Lane hotel in Liverpool Innovation Park at around pm yesterday while screamingyoud just paid me my f***ing £.Co-workers at the site today claimed a banking glitch meant their Friday wages were paid on Monday - but the rampaging tradesman hadnt realised.Police are now looking to trace the digger driver, who was named as John by desperate colleagues filmed trying to stop his trail of destruction.The labourer ran from the scene seconds before police arrived at the site and another worker was treated for minor injuries.It is understood the suspect had been working for Cheshire-based MF Construction - who were the groundworks contractor for the project - at the time of the incident.Workers told The Sun Online a delay in wages over the weekend sparked the mayhem after the suspect had waited for bosses to arrive at the site.One said: “The money was supposed to go into his bank on Friday.“But there was some kind of glitch and it didn’t go in until Monday.“He didn’t check his bank account and didn’t realise he’d actually been paid. That’s why he went mental and wrecked the place.”Another added: “I’ve been told the lad thought he’d not got his money.“But it just went into his bank account late and he didn’t check his account on the Monday.”Ceiling fixer Samuel White, , said yesterday: Wed put the last tile in, cleaned up and made sure everything was perfect.Then some idiot in a mini digger decided to drive through the middle of the building.There were loads of workers outside all gobsmacked, jaws to the floor wondering whats going on.The site manager was running around like a headless chicken, he wasnt happy at all.West-Yorkshire based Triton Construction, who are the main contractors for the site said the labourer had been waiting for his boss to arrive at around pm when the carnage unfolded.A spokesperson for Triton Construction said: “It is our understanding that one of the labourers working for MF Construction had been waiting for his boss to arrive with his wages which he told other workers on site were overdue.It is alleged that the labourer couldn’t track down the owner of MF Construction and he became increasingly frustrated. At approximately .pm the labourer took it upon himself to drive a small mini excavator through the entrance screen of the hotel and subsequently caused damage to finishes within the reception.The labourer then ran from the scene and to our knowledge is being pursued by the police. Fortunately there appear to be no structural damage so repairs can be undertaken relatively quickly.A statement released by Merseyside police on Monday evening read: “We are appealing for information after damage was caused to a hotel under construction in Liverpool.“A report was received shortly before pm that the digger was being driven into the entrance of the Travelodge building in the Liverpool Innovation Park.One man experienced eye irritation due to exposure to diesel and was treated at the scene by North West ambulance service.It is not believed anyone  was injured during the incident. Merseyside fire and rescue services and contractors attended to ensure the site was safe.The extensive damage caused to the building, including broken glass and fallen debris, can still be seen at the entrance.Metal fencing has been erected around the hotel front as workers today took deliveries of replacement materials.The labourer was filmed screaming  f***ing quid, all you had to do was pay me my  f***ing quid as he demolished the lobby of the newly-built hotel.Desperate co-workers could be heard shouting John... John thats enough as the digger tore through the entrance of the building.But the footage has pulled on the nation’s heartstrings and a GoFundMe page was set up yesterday.Former builder Jack Wellon, from Staunton, near Gloucester, said many people who work in trade encounter “similar situations week in, week out” regarding unpaid wages.He wrote: “I used to work in the building trade here in The Cotswolds and know how the industry can work.“It’s amazing to see all the workmen, families and everyone helping chip together to support this guy after he really stood up for himself and his wages.”One man replied: “The man’s a legend! Standing up for the hard-working man, Too many companies not paying their workers what is owed!Another added: “We have all been this guy at one point in our working lives.”The page initially set a target of £ but raised more than £, in just  hours.MF Construction could not be reached for comment.

title: niece fleeced great aunt fund lavish lifestyle facebook
story: Stephanie Colasanti, , spent £, of Glenda Bennett’s money on holidays, shopping sprees, a car and funding her drug use.A  judge told selfish Colasanti she used the -year-olds bank account “as your own piggy bank” after her relative had inherited almost half a million pounds.When the elderly woman’s money ran out, she asked Colasanti, of Wanborough, Swindon, Wiltshire,she could move into the flat she had bought and given her great niece a half share in.But after Colasanti refused, Ms Bennett tried to take her own le.Colasanti, who pleaded not guilty, was convicted of two counts of fraud following a trial last year and even now claims her victim “framed her”.The jury heard how after Ms Bennett had come into £, she showered gts on her great niece.But unknown to her partially deaf great aunt the defendant started to use her telephone banking to fund her lestyle.And she also claimed she was spending huge sums renovating the flat and on Open University fees when in reality she was keeping the cash for herself.Between  and  she enjoyed trips to India, Egypt, Greece, Kenya, Cape Verde and Ibiza.Colasanti posted a string of photos of her globetrotting on Facebook.When the octogenarian found her bank accounts had been cleaned out she initially thought she had been the victim of fraud.But when the finger pointed at Colasanti the defendant tried to persuade the doting aunt she was mistaken by playing on her emotions.She even phoned her and surreptitiously recorded the conversation, despite being warned off by police, in what the judge said “illustrates your conniving character”.In her defence, Colasanti, who represented herself, said she was not guilty and sought to appeal.Speaking from the dock she said she had suffered mental health problems and had issues in the past but had not done anything dishonest.Colasanti said: I do not believe that in the event of a jury finding me guilty in something they didnt understand is fair, either.”She claimed that all of her holidays were paid out of her wages as she worked hard in a -hour a week position.Judge Jason Taylor QC said: You received approximately £,, not all of that was fraudulently.Your great aunt was extremely generous with you and gted you money.“That generosity was not enough for you.”In  she received £,, just over £, a year later and just over £, in .While sentencing her at Swindon Crown Court last week, the judge said the criminal standard was £, and Colasanti only stopped the spending spree because “the money ran out”.Judge Taylor said: The level of compassion and empathy in the face of her undeserved generosity is staggering.”He added that she hadn’t demonstrated any remorse and “regretted” having to face the court.He said: I consider you manipulative, self-centred, and somebody who has no regard for anybody but yourself.You are motivated solely by greed. What you did with the money had made Miss Bennetts latter years utterly miserable.You still deny it even telling the probation officer that your great aunt framed you.This case is particularly sad.You have broken hearts and ided a family and my sincere hope is that you will take time in custody to finally stop blaming others.

title: tories put on election footing in case theresa mays brexit deal is defeated again
story: Sir Mick Davis, the chief executive of the party, briefed officials yesterday, Thereported.But MPs fear that the party isnt anywhere near ready for another poll - and the coffers dont have the cash for one.Tory donors may fear giving money to Theresa May to fight another vote after she lost s crunch vote and slashed the Governments majority.The PM has said she wont fight the next election, scheduled for , but she could try and cling ontheres a snap vote next month.One MP told The Sun Online: The party arent ready for another election.Financially, theyve not got the money - I think we would go into debt with a snap election.Last week it was revealed that Whitehall was being put on alert for another poll.And ex-Tory leader William Hague said privately he thought another vote was on the cards too.Some MPs believe that as Jeremy Corbyns popularity fades the Tories could push for extra seats and get enough for a majority to force the Brexit deal through.The Tories have been ahead in recent polls - but they were miles in front before s disastrous election too.One Brexiteer told The Sun Online they wouldnt stand on a Tory manesto for Mrs Mays hated Brexit deal as it stands now.Many Leave-backing MPs say the only way they will get behind her isthe Northern Ireland backstop gets taken out.Speaker John Bercow - known for his pro-EU sympathies - will choose which ones MPs can vote on.COOPER - NINE-MONTH DELAYYvette Cooper is tabling a bill to stop Britain leaving the EU without a deal on March .She proposes thatthere isnt a deal by February , MPs could delay Article  for nine months - giving ministers until the end of the  to secure a withdrawal agreement.The bill is a standalone law, but an amendment to the PMs statement would see it catapulted to the top of the Commons agenda.Jeremy Corbyn is considering supporting the move, which would give it a good chance of passing.GRIEVE - WRECKING BREXITDominic Grieve has proposed an amendment which would effectively transfer power from the Government to the Commons.Under the terms of his proposal, MPs would get the power to decide which bills are debated in Parliament, a privilege usually held by ministers.The amendment would tear up centuries of precedent by limiting the Governments ability to govern and so is unlikely to succeed.Last night Jeremy Corbyn and his frontbench allies tabled an amendment laying out Labours policy.The non-binding motion would see Britain seek to reopen the withdrawal agreement - something the EU insists is impossible.It also suggests that the Government should allow MPs to vote on whether or not to back a second referendum.BENN - NONSTOP VOTESSenior backbencher Hilary Benn wants ministers to stage a series of indicative votes on what to do next.That would allow MPs to have their say on their preferred outcome - from No Deal to a second referendum.CREASY - CITIZENS ASSEMBLYAn amendment from Labour Remainer Stella Creasy is a bid to secure a citizens assembly on Brexit.It would force the Government to delay Article , then convene an assembly of  representative voters to discuss the way forward.REEVES - STOP THE CLOCKLabours Rachel Reeves has drawn up an amendment which would simply delay BrexitBritain is heading towards a No Deal.Its a simplied version of the bill tabled by Yvette Cooper.DOCTORS - CANCEL BREXITA group of pro-EU MPs from a medical background are planning an amendment which would trigger a second referendum.Tory Remainer Sarah Wollaston is drawing up the motion which she says would allow voters to express informed consent to Brexit.Today MPs are putting down their own rival plans to Mrs Mays deal - including options for another Brexit referendum, extending Article  to have more time to get a deal.But shes under mounting pressure to let her MPs have a free vote on the issues next week, to find out what they really want.Amber Rudd warned that  ministers could walk outshe doesnt.

title: eurocrats force ireland hard border no deal brexit
story: Eurocrats announced for the first time there will be checks and infrastructure at the frontierBritain quits without an agreement.The Commission also warned a UK crash-out would endanger the peace process and said contingency work with Dublin is intensying.A spokesman said: In a No Deal scenario in Ireland I think it is pretty obvious you will have a hard border.The shock outburst represents the first time Brussels has openly said a No Deal Brexit would mean ato a hard border.Irelands PM Leo Varadkar has repeatedly insisted that could never happen under any circumstances.Last week he said: We are not planning for checks on the land border in Northern Ireland.”Butthe UK leaves without a deal Dublin will be legally obliged to impose controls to defend the outer frontier of the blocs single market.The DUPs Brexit spokesman Sammy Wilson accused the EU of making the remarks to try and scare MPs into voting for a bad deal.He said: More belligerent bluffing from the EU in a desperate attempt to up the ante. It didn’t work before and it won’t work now.The revelations came as it emerged EU states are set to pressure Ireland into softening its stance on the backstopNo Deal is taken off the table.Member states are so worried about a UK crash-out they will make behind-the-scenes representations to Dublin, according to German newspaper Handelsblatt.EU diplomats have insisted the backstop is only likely to be reopenedIreland publicly agrees to a renegotiation.One said: Member states aren’t going to send out the message that they value their relationship with a country that’s leaving over one that’s staying.If Dublin were to move and indicate otherwise then that might change the picture.But the first signs of cracks within the bloc emerged yesterday as Poland proposed limiting the border solution to five years to avoid no deal.Foreign minister Jacek Czaputowicz said Ireland should make the move to unblock the negotiations but was immediately slapped down by Dublin and Berlin.EU capitals are expecting negotiations on a deal to go down to the wire as both sides end up involved in a game of chicken.Spains foreign minister Josep Borrell said: In the EU all agreements are achieved on the razors edge, at the last moment.

title: annegret kramp karrenbauer irish backstop
story: Unlikely because it does not yet exist and requires a sharp change of attitude on all sides.But in times of crisis, ­anything is possible.Hardline Tory Brexiteers are now prepared to vote for ­Theresa May’s shattered EU Withdrawal Bill — as long as she ditches the wretched Northern Ireland backstop.Meanwhile, Germany is under siege from its political and industrial leaders, who are finally speaking out against a breach in trade and security ties with a vital European ally.Together this makes it ­possible to navigate a way through the thicket of bitterness and rancour which has soured ­politics, ided families and split the British nation.It requires a change of tack from Theresa May — never an easy ask.The PM’s deal is toxic because it hands Northern ­Ireland to Brussels as a ­province of the EU.Cutting out this tumour would win Mrs May the backing of at least  MPs, including Tory Brexiteers and the hardline DUP.Remainers would have ­little choice but to join in, giving Mrs May her majority and scuppering Jeremy ­Corbyn’s demands for a snap election.This might be seen as an impossible dream, not least because the hated backstop was allegedly invented in Downing Street, not Brussels.German negotiators pounced on an easy win.Now Berlin, the ultimate EU power broker, is facing fierce protests from industrialists over the risk to car, aerospace and engineering giantsBritain leaves with No Deal.“A hard Brexit would be disastrous,” says Dieter Kempf, head of Germany’s BDI — the equivalent of our Confederation of British Industry.“It would cause great dficulty for tens of thousands of companies and hundreds of thousands of workers on both sides.”Friday’s touching note from German politicians to The Times newspaper pleads with Britain to stay — or at least leave on friendly terms.But this is no love letter. It is hard-nosed realism.Signicantly, it bears the ­signature of Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, Angela Merkel’s chosen successor as Germany’s next Chancellor.Her appeal can be seen as a rebuke to Mrs Merkel, who rejected David Cameron’s plea for help to curb immigration, tipping ­Britain towards Brexit.Brits might have chosen dferentlyshe had responded to voters’ dismay not just in Britain but across the EU.She later signed her own political death warrant by flinging open Europe’s borders to a million Syrian migrants.But voters’ resentment towards arrogant EU leaders — recorded by their own Eurostat polling system — long predates immigration.Embattled French President Emmanuel Macron recently admitted he had dared not offer his voters a “Frexit”  ­referendum — because they would leave in a flash.Weeks later, his fears were confirmed as “yellow-vest” anarchists set Paris ablaze.French observers believe the gilets jaunes riots have their origins in another referendum crisis.In , France voted overwhelmingly against the European Constitution — only to see it renamed the Lisbon Treaty and slyly introduced against their express wishes.The European Constitution, like the disastrous euro, was a crucial but unpopular step towards a federal European superstate.Ireland and ­Denmark have also voted down EU moves to ever-closer union.They were told to vote again until they said Yes.Brussels’ arrogant contempt for ordinary voters — dismissed by one French president as “scum” — is what politicians blithely describe as the “democratic deficit”.It sowed the seeds for Brexit. Immigration simply brought it to a head.Germany’s letter to The Times reads like a plea from a deserted lover.“Without your great nation, this continent would not be what it is today — a community defined by freedom and ­prosperity,” writes Germany’s next Chancellor.“Should Britain wish to leave the European Union for good, it will always have friends in Germany and Europe.”This is precisely what British voters hoped for as they ­teetered on the brink of Remain but opted to Leave.They wanted a civilised orce between economic and diplomatic allies.This is still possiblethe border issue can be resolved.If we can persuade the IRA to decommission deadly weapons, surely we can decommission a backstop that nobody wants Theresa May’s rejected deal is not a total failure. Without this problem it could still fly.Germany holds the key.If Mrs Kramp-Karrenbauer means what she said about friendship, now is the time to prove it.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: brit teen spends 1500 hours
story: NewsBrit teen spends , hours and £, to turn herself into a living dollKrista Magica, , of Kent, said dressing up like a doll will boost her confidenceShareCommentsByTfany Lo:,  JAN NewsKrista Magica has been transforming herself into a living doll everyday in the past two years "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA young adult who enjoys spending , hours and pound, to transforming herself into a living doll has spoken how the make-over boosted her confidence. Krista Magica, of Sevenoaks, Kent, has dedicated two hours every morning for the last two years creating her signature Lolita doll-like look - with bubblegum pink hair, porcelain white skin and enlarged eyes. The -year-old even wears pixie ears and three sets of  eyelashes to complete the outfit. Her pink-heavy wardrobe features fashion choices from flouncy Victorian-style dresses and Japanese anime-inspired outfits to big  shoes and sparkly crowns.  Krista uses foundation to create a porcelain skin effect and cleverly makes her eyes look huge with eye shadow, white eyeliner, three sets of  eyelashes and coloured contact lenses. The fashion and jewellery designer, who describes herself as a cute magical monster doll from space, also dyes her naturally brown hair pink but mostly relies on wigs as the colour fades fast. Having previously struggled with her mental health, Krista credits her living doll look for her renewed confidence and has even met her boyfriend thanks to it. Krista said: “It takes me around two hours to get ready everyday. It’s pretty long but it’s quite therapeutic to just sit there and do my makeup. “I have always wanted to stand out and as soon as I got into the living doll look, I realised how happy this fashion makes people. “When I go out people like to take pictures of me. A lot of older ladies askthey can take pictures of me to show their grandchildren. It’s really interesting. I don’t get any bad comments.  “On social media people seem to look up to me. I have a lot of people who tell me they’ve been inspired by me. It’s so sweet. It’s really amazing. “And it makes me happy to surround myself with cute things. It’s made me so much more confident. It’s so nice. “It makes me smile and it makes other people smile so I don’t think it’s ever going to stop. “I have always been obsessed with anime and Japanese fashion. “When I was younger I was an emo goth so when I started getting into Japanese fashion I was like ‘wow this is so dferent and so colourful’. It was the complete opposite of what I was.  “When I was , I dyed my hair pink and I was like ‘this is cute, it’s staying’. It went from there and I started overhauling my wardrobe as much as I could. “I have always loved the doll look so I started buying Lolita dresses which are big fluffy Victorian-style dresses in pastel colours. “With Lolita fashion you need to wear petticoats and this giant dress so eventually I started to look for something more practical for when I’m just going to the shop. “Doing the doll makeup was a big learning curve. Over the years my eyes have got bigger and bigger using lashes and lenses. It’s just escalated. “My hair is still pink but I have five wigs because you get a more even colour and can do more with them. There are still times when I might feel to anxious and I dont want to leave the house but getting ready and doing my makeup is so therapeutic it helps. Honestly, I think when I first got into the doll look, I was looking for comfort. Its very comforting being surrounded by cute things. It has made me so much happier. And this look hasnt just given my confidence, theres so much in my le I wouldnt have without it.  Overhauling her look from a goth teen wearing black clothes, dark makeup and black leather boots was a daunting task for Krista with some anime-inspired outfits costing pound. But in a bid to cut down on the costs, Krista avoids high-end makeup brands and has taught herself how to make her own clothes and accessories. The teen has learnt so much she has been able to launch her own clothing and jewellery brand called Planet Magica which she sells through her Etsy shop. Krista said: “When I first got into doll fashion, I was working at a pub and I didn’t have much money. “Overhauling your wardrobe is a big task and a lot of Japanese fashion can be really expensive. Just one PVC outfit can cost pound. “I think I’ve probably spent around pound, a year but I make so much myself. I had to teach myself how to make clothes and accessories. At first when people would message me asking where I got something or how I achieved my look I would feel like a fraud. You hear about people in the community spending thousands and thousands and Im here wearing three sets of Poundland  eyelashes. “But now I’m so proud that my passion for fashion has lead to me starting my own brand and I have grown enough of a following to be self-employed. “It’s not a huge following but it’s tight-knit and they’re so supportive. As soon as I launched I was immediately getting sales.” As well as boosting her self-esteem and inspiring her business, Krista’s transformation has shown her who her true friends are after many decided they no longer wanted to be seen with her. Her doll look also lead her to love as she met her boyfriend Harry Valentine, , through the alternative nightclub scene.  Krista said: “When I started wearing this otherworldly doll fashion, the friends I had then flat-out refused to go anywhere with me. They didn’t like that people were staring. “I understand now that a lot of people don’t want that. They don’t want anybody to even notice that they’re there. “But putting myself out there has helped me so much with my confidence. And it’s how I met my boyfriend.“He wrote to me on Facebook because he thought I was somebody he’d seen at an alternative club. I’d never been to any of the clubs at that point.“Meeting him was like my gateway to the alternative world and now I’ve got all these absolutely colourful friends and we go to the clubs together. “When we’re all out people ask ‘where are you going  Where’s the fancy dress party ’ It’s great.”

title: brexit labour not suddenly swung
story: NewsBrexit: Why Labour has NOT suddenly swung behind a second referendumLabour has spelt out more detail of its plan for Brexit - including a vote on a second referendum. Heres an explanation of what the plan actually means, and why its less simplistic than some might suggestShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video listen-interview-shadow-business-secretary-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailLate last night, Labour unveiled its latest plan for Brexit. It was hailed by backers of a second EU referendum, who called it a big step forward and grabbing the Brexit bull by the horns. Anti-Peoples Vote MPs then hit back warning they wont support going back to the public. One newspaper called it Corbyn backs plan for second referendum. But amid all the sound and fury, what Labour has suggested isnt actually as dramatic as you might think. Heres a quick explanation of Jeremy Corbyns amendment, what it will do - and what it wont do.  Labour has unveiled an amendment to Theresa Mays Brexit plan ahead of a string of showdown votes by MPs next Tuesday night. If MPs pass it, the Prime Minister would be forced to give MPs a vote on options to prevent a No Deal Brexit on March . Those options would have to include:Negotiating changes to the Brexit deal to secure Labours demands - a permanent customs union with the EU, a strong relationship with the single market and dynamic alignment on workers rights. A second referendum, but only on a deal or a proposition that has commanded the support of the majority of the House of Commons.Why are people excited about it   Since September, Labour has been sitting on the fence about exactly how it should solve Brexit. Jeremy Corbyn has kept a second referendum as one option on the table, which apes a motion activists passed at the party conference. Activists are now demanding he swing % behind a second EU referendum after his bid to force a general election didnt succeed. So this new motion, promising a vote down the line on holding a second referendum, has caused lots of excitement. What do second referendum supporters say   Labour MP David Lammy of the anti-Brexit Peoples Vote campaign said: It is a big step forward that for the first time my party is acknowledging in a parliamentary amendment that a People’s Vote may be the only way forward. At the same time, the leadership is saying that Labour’s own Brexit plan should now take centre stage as this crisis unfolds.It is right that any proposal for Brexit deserves to be properly scrutinised. It is only when MPs have had the chance to look properly at these proposals, along with Norway Plus and a catastrophic no deal departure from the EU that they will really be able to decide whether they meet the promises made for Brexit in  and are at least as good as the deal we already have inside Europe. TSSA General Secretary Manuel Cortes said: This is an exemplary and timely amendment with Labour now grabbing the Brexit bull by its horns as May continues to pander to the far right in her party and outside it.“By all means, Labour must now push the government to negotiate a damage limiting Brexit and it is right that our Party now insist that the British people have sign off on any deal.Of course, not agreeing to the deal and staying as we are must be an option when the people do get that final say. But what do allies of Jeremy Corbyn say   Labour suggest the amendment is simply being faithful to the partys conference motion. Shadow business secretary Rebecca Long Bailey said it does not in any way mean the party is backing a second referendum - yet. Instead she told the BBC: The amendment is very specically-worded to allow for the debate of the options. It is not stating that the party supports a second referendum in any way. And indeedit was passed, the amendment, and it went to a vote on the specic issues, then that would be a decision for the party to take at the time. We are prioritising seeking a deal which provides many of the assurances we have sought from the PM. Plus - the amendment may well not pass  Leading Tory Remainers, such as Anna Soubry, have suggested they wont back Labours Plan B amendment. Without the support of a good number of Tory rebels, the amendment is unlikely to pass through Parliament. If thats the case, the MPs vote on a second referendum wouldnt happen. And a Peoples Vote might not have a majority... Under Labours plan a Peoples Vote would need a majority of support in Parliament in order to be held. Supporters of a second referendum concede it might not have a majority in Parliament yet. So has anything changed  Well of course, yes - Labour has laid out more of its plan and the path it wants to tread from here. The promise of a vote on a second EU referendum brings the party a small step closer to backing one, somewhere down the line. Butyou think itll mean a snap EU referendum just yet - you may be a little disappointed. Full text of Labours amendment [This House] “requires ministers to secure sufficient time for the UK Parliament to consider and vote on options to prevent the UK leaving the EU without a ratied Withdrawal Agreement and Political Declaration, and that those options should include:Negotiating changes to the draft Withdrawal Agreement and Political Declaration so as to secure a permanent customs union with the EU, a strong relationship with the single market underpinned by shared institutions and obligations, and dynamic alignment on rights and standards, in order to command a majority in the House of CommonsLegislating to hold a public vote on a deal or a proposition that has commanded the support of the majority of the House of Commons.”. What about all the other Plan Bs  You can read our full guide here.

story: NewsGrenfell-style cladding branded a national shame as Mirror reveals cover-up"If the government cant fix problems this serious and this urgent, what on earth is it in office for "ShareCommentsByNick SommerladDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video tower-block-cladding-cover-up-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe state of tower block cladding  months after the Grenfell Tower fire has been branded a cause for national shame after the Mirror revealed a cover-up. We reported the firm which built Manchesters X shyEastlands block tried to cover up the results and families were not told for weeks. Housing Minister Kit Malthouse said fire service chiefs had assured him residents of the block are safe tonight. But the top Tory admitted hes certainly not an expert himself. Discussing the case during an urgent question in the Commons, Shadow Housing Secretary John Healey said: Whatever the minister says hes doing, it isnt working. If the government cant fix problems this serious and this urgent, what on earth is it in office for   The Labour MP said: This should be a cause for national shame that over  months after the Grenfell Tower fire, Im having to drag ministers to the House because there are still buildings in this country cloaked in the Grenfell style cladding with residents who dont knowtheir homes are safe. He added: There were  high rise blocks with the same Grenfell style cladding and  are yet to have this removed and replaced. Nothing has yet changed, the Government is ignoring warnings, our constituents are going to bed afraid, current measures are not working, as one of the Grenfell survivors said, Grenfell two is in the post. How many more must die before the Government takes positive action to keep people safe in their beds  Minister Mr Malthouse slammed Labours antagonistic approach saying the governments response was immediate and wide-ranging. But he admitted he was cajoling firms in the private sector and more assertive measures may be needed. Without specying any inidual firm he said: He is correct that we will get to a point where there are a small number of owners or contractors who put this cladding on buildings where we will need to consider more assertive measures. But he said of the block we highlighted in Manchester: I understand that the local fire and rescue service are satisfied that everybody is safe in that building tonight and that temporary measures are in place while the work is done. Obviously there seems to be some complication about getting that work done but nevertheless it is being done. The Tory minister insisted: All the while, in all of this - and he [John Healey] may present himself as an expert but Im certainly not - we are guided by expert opinion. That includes Dame Judith Hackitts review but also the independent expert , advisory group that was constituted in the immediate aftermath of Grenfell. We follow their advice in making sure that we can guarantee peoples safety tonight. Mr Malthouse said the primary focus was interim measures to make buildings immediately safe.  The minister said interim measures were in place on all  high-rise private residential blocks with unsafe ACM cladding. Nick Sweeney, chief executive officer at X Developments, which owns the property, told our reporter his firm knew the test had taken place and had been “made aware” of the shypreliminary findings received by Forrest. story: NewsPO Ferries to re-flag ships to be under the Cyprus flag ahead of BrexitThe company said they were taking the decision in advance of Britain leaving the EUShareByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN NewsThe company mooted the change last year "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email PO Ferries is to re-flag all its ships which operate on the English Channel to be under the Cyprus flag ahead of Brexit.The company said they were taking the decision ahead of Britains departure to keeptax arrangements in the EU. it will also mean fewer inspections and delays.Last monthPO said it was re-flagging two of its UK ships operating on the English Channel route to France to the Cyprus registry. The firm said in a statement: In advance of Britain leaving the European Union on th March , we undertook a review of the flag status of our ships on the English Channel. For operational and accounting reasons, we have concluded that the best course of action is to re-flag all ships to be under the Cyprus flag. The Cyprus flag is on the white list of both the Paris and Tokyo Memoranda of Understanding, resulting in fewer inspections and delays, and will result in signicantly more favourable tonnage tax arrangements as the ships will be flagged in an EU member state.   We have no plans to make any other changes, including the terms and conditions of any of our seafarers, as a result of the new arrangements. It comes after cross-channel rival Brittany Ferries changed around , bookings to accommodate extra sailings in case of a no-deal Brexit.The company said timetables from Portsmouth, Poole and Plymouth were being changed to ensure critical goods could still be transported. Brittany Ferries said about , customers were affected. n December, the government announced it was awardingpound.m to three suppliers to provide extra capacityto ease congestion at Doverthe UK leaves the European Union without a deal on  March. French company Brittany Ferries was awarded pound.m, pound.m was awarded to Danish shipping firm DFDS and pound.m to British firm Seaborne Freight. It comes as a top Cabinet minister has warned that up to  Tory ministers are poised to quit Theresa Mayforces through plans for a No DealBrexit. Amber Rudd is understood to have told Downing Street it could suffer the exodus unless ministers get a say on blocking No Deal. Ms Rudd is said to want a free vote on plans that would allow the  March Brexit date to be extendedtheres no agreement. title: dad cant afford loo roll
story: NewsDad cant afford loo roll after benefits were stopped while he was in hospitalRichard Smith, form Stoke-on-Trent, says he has started drinking again due to his situation with the Department of Work and PensionsShareCommentsByRuby Davies:,  JAN NewsRichard Smith is in dispute with the Department of Work and Pensions "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA former carpet fitter claims he cant even afford loo roll after his benefits were stopped while he was in hospital. Ive had noChristmas, I could only afford a couple of corned beef sandwiches for my Christmas dinner. When I was receiving ESA I managed to go three years without having a drink. title: dolphin rubbish tied around mouth
story: NewsDolphin with rubbish tied around its mouth found washed up on British beachHeartbreaking images show the female animal with "very deep injuries" to her rostrum before it washed back out to seaShareCommentsByAlexandra KalisperasJohn Bett:,  JAN NewsThe dolphin appeared to have rubbish around its mouth "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA dolphin has washed up dead on a British beach with rubbish caught around its mouth and deep injuries. The animal was found by Sandra Hilton who took this distressing image before reporting the find to the relevant authorities. The animal was washed up behind the Royal Channel Islands Yacht Club, Jersey with rubbish around its rostrum. Officers from Jersey’s States’ Fisheries and Marine Resources Department were unable to locate it but urge islanders to look out for it as it was tagged. Paul Chambers, who works in the department, said: The dolphin may have drted back out to sea but, with the tides at the moment, it will probably come back in again. It is a female common dolphin and obviously has some injuries to its snout area.   It looks assomething became wrapped around its beak and there are a series of very deep injuries. It could have been a piece of rubbish that got wrapped around its beak or it could have got caught in fishing gear and struggled to get out. It did look emaciated and could have starved to death but I will have to wait for the dolphin to be recovered - I cannot guarantee the cause of death. Mr Chambers said staff from his section had gone down to the beach to pick up the animal yesterday morning but had been unable to locate it. story: NewsMichael McIntyres Big Show singer attacked by stalker ex after performanceRachel Crowe, , was stalked and assaulted by her ex James Hall on the same day she became the comedians unexpected star on the Saturday night programmeShareCommentsByJon HarrisAbigail OLeary:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video rachel-crowe-sings-michael-mcintyres-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman who appeared on the BBCs Michael McIntyre’s Big Show has said she she is living in fear of her jealous ex-boyfriend after he harassed her following her TV appearance. Singer Rachel Crowe, , was stalked and assaulted by her ex James Hall on the same day she became the comedians unexpected star on the Saturday night programme. On January , Hall approached Miss Crowe in a bar and followed her to her car where he grabbed her by the arm and pulled her to the floor. When she managed to get into her vehicle, he attempted to rip her wing mirror off and jumped on the car bonnet as she attempted to leave. On another occasion, Hall, , from Bolton, Greater Manchester went to Miss Crowes home and woke her up during the early hours banging on the front window, begging her to take him back.He also hounded Miss Crowe with  emails in just three days from dferent email addresses, one such being “pleaseRacheldontdothis@gmail”.In a statement to police Miss Crowe, a trained opera singer who also works as a choreographer, said: I feel scared and afraid to leave my house. I’m afraid of coming across the defendant whilst I’m out because of these incidents.   “He can be angry and aggressive. He could hurt me. I find his behaviour intimidating and worrying. As I am a singer, I am worried he could turn up as I’m working, which is what has happened on previous occasions.” At Manchester magistrates Court, Hall, a former accounts student, pleaded guilty to assault by beating and the stalking of Miss Crowe. He appeared emotionless as he was handed a  week prison sentence suspended for  months. Prosecuting, Carl Gaffney said: “The aggrieved Miss Rachel Crowe and the defendant were in a relationship for  months. She describes an escalation regarding his behaviour towards her, and she used words such as ‘jealous’, ‘bullying’ and ‘aggressive’ to describe his behaviour towards her. “In October last year they split up. There were two sets of incidents. Firstly, there were hundreds of emails sent to the complainant from a number of dferent addresses which had been found. “Some of them were made out to be humorous in an attempt to be playful, but this was beyond inappropriate. For example, one of the email addresses was “ pleaseRacheldontdothis@gmail ”.“It was a dull echo of what it was like when she could have been with him, it was described. The emails are benign. The emails became far more frequent as he asked to be taken back. “His behaviour towards her showed that he talked about their physical tendencies. There were a number of incidents also. “The aggrieved goes out on January th. She is out with a friend when he appeared in the same bar demanding to speak to her.   “He appears in front of her face. She manages to escape when her group go to a dferent bar. He followed her into the bar but he was refused entry to the establishment. She became successful in hiding. “However, when she leaves to go to her car out the back, he grabbed her by the arm and pulled her to the ground. She managed to get up and get into her car and locked it. “He then started trying to rip her wing mirror off before jumping on the bonnet of her car trying to stop her from leaving. He was taken off the bonnet by assisting people. “On Janaury th the aggrieved was at her home address when the second incident occurred. He was outside her address uninvited and unsolicited. She was woken up by banging on the windows as the defendant attempted to gain entry. “She was concerned about the noise so went to the front of her address and the defendant was there, begging to get in, but she refused. She remained at the front of the address and she phoned the police and texted her mother and told her she needed to come due to him being outside.   “The defendant then moved round to the back of the address and climbed into the rear garden where he continued banging on the rear door shouting at the aggrieved to let him in. “The defendant was there for up to two hours before he left the address. The police did not come in that timescale. After being arrested, he made signicant admissions and there was immediately no hesitation to guilty pleas. He is a man of a certain physical stature. The court heard Hall had previously appeared before magistrates in Cumbria last November for criminal damage after he had a bust up with Miss Crowe during a wedding.   A probation report compiled by an unnamed author said: “He tells me he didn’t pull the victim to the floor at all, though he did acknowledge jumping on the car bonnet when he thought she was going to drive at him. “Regarding the texts and emails, he said he did make contact as described, but said the victim had sometimes responded to his contact and he said this caused him to make further contact. He used her response to his emails as justication for his actions without giving considerable thought for the impact on the victim. “He said this was a turbulent relationship with the victim because of his alcohol misuse, caused by his dficulties sleeping. This was an angry reaction to the breakdown of the relationship. He kept his own thoughts above that of his victims. He would benefit from intervention to address the offending of this nature.” Halls lawyer Nick Ross said: “He recognises this is over and it’s sensible for this to be over. Regarding the conviction for criminal damage, he ‘kicked off’ at a wedding whilst in drink. He caused some damage to some items at the wedding. He found himself homeless after a fall out with his father. “His behaviour was very persistent, but only over a few days. It was not his place or position to place his arm out to restrain her, it was a little more persistent on the arm of the complainant. He did do that and recognised he was overstepping the line. This assault was not a punch or a kick or a slap.”   Hall was also ordered to complete a two year community order, pay pound costs and he was ordered to engage in a Building Better Relationships programme. Sentencing Deputy District Judge Thomas Moran said: “You have clearly got a problem with relationships and you have come close to receiving a prison sentence judging by the way you pursued your former partner who is clearly terried of you. “I order for there to be no compensation offered - that is the last thing she is interested in. What she wants you to do is leave her alone,you don’t you will find yourself back here and going to prison.” Hall was also made subject of a restraining order for five years, which prohibits him from making any contact with Miss Crowe or attending her address.

story: NewsFurious grandad refuses to pay £ parking fine given for ridiculous reasonDouglas Mellor, , of Huddersfield in West Yorkshire was shocked when the fine dropped through his letterboxShareCommentsByWayne Ankers:,  JAN NewsThe -year-old grandfather is refusing to pay the ticket "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA furious grandad is refusing to pay a pound parking fine, claiming he was slapped with it for a ridiculous reason.Douglas Mellor, , was hit with the fine after dropping his grandson Scott Dawson off at the gym in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire.After dropping Scott off, the pensioner, who drives a blue Renault Captur, took his we Geraldine to a dentist appointmentHe came back an hour later to collect his grandson and they all went off to enjoy fish and chips together, Examiner Live reports. title: pregnant single mum stuck freezing
story: NewsPregnant single mum stuck in freezing house covered in mould cant stop cryingYvonne Mcmullan, , from Liverpool, says she is begging her housing association to provide her with a new home before she gives birth in four monthsShareCommentsByFaye BrownAbigail OLeary:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN NewsYvonne [right] pictured being held by her mum says she cant stop crying over the state of her home"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA pregnant single mum is desperate to be rehomed from her house which she says is freezing cold and mouldy. Yvonne Mcmullan , says she cant stop crying over the state of her home and is begging the housing association to provide her with a new one. The expectant mum, who already has a two-year-old daughter, is desperate for a new home before she gives birth in four months. But Yvonne says despite this, the housing association have refused her request. Cobalt Housing have however offered to put Yvonne and he daughter up in a hotel for a week while they carry out repairs to the property, reports the Liverpool Echo. They say the case is a legal disrepair and they are following protocol by carrying out repairs with minimal disruption and without loss of expense. But Yvonne said she would rather be moved to a new house after being told she would have totransfer all her furniture from the downstairs bedrooms before work can begin.   The worried mum, who is on benefits, said she cannot afford to put her possessions in storage, has no way of transporting them and no room to move them upstairs. Yvonne said: I want to be moved to another house. They’ve got me on a band E waiting list which is basically nothing, it could take two, maybe more, years to move. Having to move everything in and back out again while pregnant puts me under a lot of stress. I can’t be on my own here. Im constantly crying. Wereon our own and have basically been told weve just got to do it. Theres no one  who can help. Yvonne said she noticed the damp within weeks of moving in, but only managed to get anything done about it after a surveyor visited last November and found thousands of pounds worth of much-needed health and safety repairs. In a letter seen by the Liverpool Echo, a solicitor identied the home as needing repair work including a re-fitting of the kitchen where cupboards and doors have fallen off, and re-plastering in every room downstairs.   Yvonnes mum Lisa, , said: Its not just the disruption and anxiety that its causing, what they are expecting her to do at five months pregnant. Wouldnt it just be so much easier to put her on a transfer so she can get a property and then she can settle before her baby comes, rather than having to come back here where shell have to redecorate and everything  Shes tried her best to make this a home. Its so sad. its her first home. She gives everything for the baby. Shes really tried. She wont be able to redecorate when she moves back in. It saddens me. I know houses dont pop up every day, I do understand that, and there may be people in dferent situations. but Im just so worried for her. We wanted to come forward so Cobalt can take responsibility for the way Yvonnes been treated, and in the hope that maybe another landlord or housing association might reach out and be able to help us.

title: royals were normal theyd asbo
story: NewsopinionIf the Royals were normal theyd all have an ASBO - its time to get these loons off our roadsBritains attitude to Royal car crashes is a bit skew-wfShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN Newsopinion"Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPrince Philip was in a car crash in which everybody lived. But imagine, for a moment, that one little thing was dferent. Britain has been plunged into mourning by the death of Prince Philip in an horric car accident. In a tragic echo of Princess Dianas death  years ago, it is thought he was not wearing a seatbelt. The Queens strength and stay of  years was killed after he stopped his Land Rover at a junction and was hit by a second vehicle...Or perhaps: A Greek migrant is being hunted by police after crashing into a car carrying a young mum and baby on their way home from a day at the beach. The identity of the man, considered a menace by local road users, is known to officers. It is thought he is married to a local woman, although it is not clear whether he has a legal right to remain in the UK...Or even: Third-in-line to the throne Prince George escaped unscathed after his mum the Duchess of Cambridges car was in a smash on a death-trap road. The woman driver of the other vehicle, who also had a child in the back seat, was breath-tested at the scene... The fact a -year-old was involved in a collision has been used to demand older people resit their driving tests, have their licenses revoked and or be confined to barracks.But as the RAC has quite reasonably pointed out,you revoked the right to drive of those people most likely to have a smash, it would mean young people had the most to lose.So imagine a younger household name was involved: Road safety campaigners demanded footballer Raheem Sterling be jailed after a car smash with a young mum and baby. The controversial midfielder, , was seen getting behind the wheel again just a day later, and our exclusive pictures PROVE he didnt even wear a seatbelt. Young people are a bloody menace on the roads, said Prince Philip, while unveiling a plaque just a mile from the crash scene...But the problem isnt age. The problem is us, and our attitude to royalty. Had Raheem Sterling broken a womans wrist in a car accident, leaving her to get washed and dressed with help of her teenaged son, facing two months off work and possible surgery to rebreak the bones and a letime of that wrist never being quite right again, she wouldnt expect his girlfriend to send flowers. Anyone in that situation would more likely be spitting tacks at the thoughtless arsehole who caused a painful injury to a complicated joint that will require a year of rehabilitation, and would be demanding the insurance company screw him for every last penny.And theyd never expect a personal apology, on the grounds everyone in an accident knows admitting responsibility is something best left to the lawyers. The victim probably wouldnt say it could all be resolved with a phone call from Raheem askingshe was all right, because shes such a big fan of Man City.  And had Prince Philip been just about anyone , the accident might not have happened.The Royals do not know what traffic is, because they are never stuck in it. There are chauffeurs, advanced driving experts, and motorcycle outriders ensuring that they can whizz up the hard shoulder, shoot through the lights and ignore the right of way. When Philip drove his own London taxi to get around the capital, it was so he could AVOID traffic.When they get to wherever theyre going, the gates are open. Someone salutes. People wave. Everyone keeps clear of the wheels, which, of course, are always clean. You will never see a Royal in a car that has fingermarks in the weeks worth of road splatter around the doors. Youll never see their wing mirror with a ding or the wipers on their last swipe. Prince Andrew has been accused of ramming gates with his car at Windsor, and knocking over a police officer at the gates of Buckingham Palace. Princess Anne has been done for speeding at mph, and when Prince Edward was courting Sophie Rhys Jones her neighbours got used to ing into hedges to avoid being mown down as he whizzed along the country lane leading to her family home.They all do it. If that family lived in a Hackney high-rise, theyd all have an ASBO. Perhapsthey had experiences more like the rest of us, then when he pulled up to a T-junction where the sun was dazzling his vision the Duke of Edinburgh would have stopped until he could see there was no traffic.Someone with no experience of traffic, though, would assume the road was empty and just pull out. Andsomeone that daft and entitled was behind the wheel of what was literally an armoured vehicle - regardless of their age - theyd get nicked by police. If they had been ploughing into other cars on a semi-regular basis throughout their driving career, theyd get taken to court.Andthe police actually LIVED with them and spoke to them EVERY DAY, it would happen in minutes. Royals have always, traditionally, been pretty deadly. When they were around, serfs were more likely to be beaten, maids certain to be ravished, and large public protests far more likely to see their leaders run through with a sword. Wars were inevitable with every marital breakdown or romantic refusal.Removing some of their powers was a great idea, but giving them -wheel drive and several tons of moving metal to fling about the countryside at whim probably wasnt. The problem weve got is that we treat the Royals like a dferent species, and are disgusted when they act like one.We want manners and Britishness but we get rude Prussians, with fat fingers and tin ears. We bow and scrape and curtsey and mutter about why they arent a little more thoughtful, while removing from their lives all things that require deep thought - careers, taxation, a lack of opportunity.As long as we have a Royal Family that is allowed to own the place, they will continue to act like they do. Butwe demanded they had lives more like ours, they wouldnt be Royal any more - thered be nothing special about them, or perhaps more importantly us. Thats why we put up with them we like to think it rubs off.There is a solution, though: remove the gates from their palaces so they cant get out. Theyd still have lots of space to drive around, theres no traffic to bother them, and we all get to live another day.

title: polyamorous throuple plan children after
story: NewsPolyamorous throuple plan children after family members disown themHusband Paoulo Quispilaya, , and his we Kassandra Diaz-Cervo, , from Los Angeles, Calornia, both fell in love with Carly Martinez at a party in October ShareCommentsByAbigail OLearyIsolde Walters:,  JAN NewsKassandrawith her girlfriend Carlyand husband Paoulo "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA polyamorous throuple who share the same bed are planning on starting a family together. Husband Paoulo Quispilaya, , and his we Kassandra Diaz-Cervo, , both fell in love with Carly Martinez at a party in October . By February of last year, they had entered into a committed three-way relationship after Paoulo and Kassandra, from Los Angeles, Calornia, asked the -year-old poet and songwriter to join their marriage. Kassandra described how she was immediately attracted to Carly, despite never having been in a relationship with a woman before. She said: I fell in love with Carly. Prior to her, I had had chemistry with females two or three times and felt a flirtation but I had never been in a relationship with a woman. Despite the strong attraction, Kassandra did not initially act on her feelings and she became platonic friends with Carly, who had also never been with a woman before.   But when Carly started to also connect with Paoulo things became romantic and she joined the relationship in February . Carly, also of Los Angeles, Calornia, said: I felt an instant attraction to Kassandra and we became friends. I connected with Paolo in December. We had gone out to a nightclub and we just clicked and I realised that something was happening. We were a triad from the very beginning. Kassandra said: I didnt even know polyamory existed. It just happened. We were unsure of what it was.   We tried not pursuing it and suppressing our feelings because we have been taught that theres no such thing as loving two people at once. We researched it and found that there was a community and a word for it: polyamory. We decided to just do it and not be held back by social conditioning. Paoulo admitted that he had hesitations about welcoming another partner into his marriage but decided it was worth the risk. The digital marketer said: I definitely did have reservations. At first I didnt really know what it was.   I was afraid of what I was getting into and I feared that it might break up my marriage and Id be left with no one. But I knew it wasnt going to be a fling. In April , Carly moved into Paoulo and Kassandras home where the throuple sleep in the same bedroom. She explained that it has not been easy entering a marriage as a third partner. She said: It was confusing and scary. It was hard going into a marriage when they had all those years of shared experience. But how I felt about them exceeded all of the fears that I had.   The throuple admit that family members were shocked to learn of the new relationship and many could not accept it. Kassandra said: At first our families were shocked. Some to the point of no longer communicating with us. As time passed, some of them came to accept our relationship but other family members still wont speak to us. But I would never have gone through telling my familyI didnt believe this relationship was worth it. Paoulo added that it can be frustrating when people reduce their polyamorous relationship to sexual logistics. He said: Peoples first thoughts are so often sexual. They dont understand that this is a committed, long-term relationship.   They think we are just having casual threesomes. However the throuple insist that they are in it for the long-term and one day plan on raising children together. Paoulo said: We definitely will raise children together. I love my mom, I love my brother and I love my dad - our hearts are capable of loving more than one person at the same time. Its not for everyone, butyou are meant to be in a polyamorous relationship, things will naturally fall into place. The throuple share their experiences of le as a polyamorous triad on their Youtube channel Trecta Love.

story: NewsTiny Chihuahua puppy survives being dropped by hawk who swooped to eat himMiracle lb puppy landed at the feet of construction workers and has since been named Tony Hawk after the pro-skaterShareByKelly-Ann Mills:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN NewsThe tiny lb dog was lucky to be alive "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA tiny Chihuahua puppy is lucky to be alive after it was picked up by a hawk who wanted to take him away to eat. The miracle lb dog fell at the feet of construction workers who heard it crying out as the bird of prey lted him into the air. As the builders looked up to see where the noise was coming from, the pup fell to the ground. Miraculously it didnt suffer any broken bones, and was left with just a few scratches and puncture wounds from the bird.   The dog has since been named Tony Hawk, after the pro-skater and was taken to Austin Animal Center in Texas, USA. The centre posted to their Facebook page to say: Wed like to introduce you to this nugget, who weve all taken to calling Miracle Puppy. This teeny tiny guy was picked up by a hawk and then subsequently dropped from mid-air. Its a miracle that he not only survived, but that the wounds on his head and chest are fairly mild. This sweetie is now recovering in a foster home for the next few weeks.   Let Miracle Puppys story be a reminder to protect your small pets from wildle! Hawks, owls and coyotes will prey on small animals, even in your fenced backyard. If you have small pets, keep eyes on them at all times while outside. Lindsay Riddick, the vet taking care of little Tony Hawk told KVUE in Texas: We are so happy that this little fighter will live on to tell an incredible story.

Archaeologists believe they have identied the hidden location of the crypt in which they say the leaders are buried together.  The long-lost tomb of Antony and Cleopatra will be eventually uncovered. story: NewsDoctors touching guard of honour for tragic baby girl as she goes to donate organsLittle Alondra Torres Arias was declared brain dead after suffering from pneumonia, but her mum was consoled by knowing she had saved three other childrenShareCommentsByAngjela TrajkovskaDanya BazaraaNews Reporter:,  JAN Updated:,  JAN Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news world-news video doctors-guard-honour-dead-baby-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, combinedPrompt :true, subsets :[,,,,,],bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, combinedPrompt :true, subsets :[,,,,,],bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDoctors formed a touching guard of honour to pay tribute to a baby girl as she was taken into theatre to donate her organs after being declared brain dead.Little Alondra Torres Ariass parents made the brave decision to donate the one-year-olds kidneys and liver after doctors told them shed suffered brain death. Grieving mum Jenni Barraza said she was consoled by knowing her daughter had saved three other children, adding that the little girls death had not been in vain. Medics who had cared for Alondra, from Mexico, said goodbye to her in an emotional tribute as she went to perform the ultimate sacrice. A poignant video shows doctors and nurses standing next to each other in a corridor waiting for the baby to pass on a hospital bed.   When the bed approaches the staff, they clasp their hands in a praying position and look down to show respect for the parents decision to donate their daughters organs. The tribute took place at a hospital in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, as doctors transported Alondra to the operating theatre.The little girl, who suffered brain death after contracting pneumonia, had been kept alive with a respirator before being taken for her organs to be donated.   Heartbroken mum Jenni shared a message on social media saying goodbye to her daughter as she died after the surgery. As well as thanking the people that gave her support in the dficult moments, she wrote: “She probably left days before, I talked to her and kissed her until the last minute.” Nena Barrera commented: “What strength the mother and her family have, God bless them always, the sky has one more angel.” And Patito Flores added: “God bless you, I have no words.”

title: face wealthy inca woman recreated
story: NewsFace of wealthy Inca woman recreated after remains unearthed in fortressRemains were found  centimetres below the surface with ceramic objects, jewellery, animal bones and metal plates placed around herShareCommentsByKelly-Ann Mills:,  JAN NewsThe scientists managed to find most o f her skeleton "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailArchaeologists have created a computer-generated image of what a wealthy Inca woman probably looked like after discovering her remains.The scientist managed to reconstruct almost her entire skeleton after she was discovered at Pucare de Tilcara fortication on a hill outside the town of Tilcara in northern Argentina. Researchers from the National Scientic and Technical Research Councilbelieve the Inca woman had “outstanding social prestige” in the community towards the end of the Inca Empire in the th century. According to Dr Clarisa Otero, the remains were found  centimetres below the surface with ceramic objects, jewellery, animal bones and metal plates placed around her.   She said: “This discovery reinforced the ideas we have about pre-Hispanic funerary practices and in turn gives us new and valuable information. The absence of a coffin to contain the corpse and the presence of fauna shows that the woman was partially or completely exposed.This implies that once the body was buried in the courtyard, it was not moved. She added: “Although we know that her first years of le did not take place at the site, due to the types of offerings found at her grave, her role in the community would have been important.”   Experts believe that the woman came from an elite group from the region of Tahuantinsuyo and was in the area of Tilcara when the Spanish arrived. Dr Otero said: “The first thing we found was the woman’s skull, which was unexpected as graves were usually dug in the corners of homes.” After finding the skull, specialists were able to nearly complete the woman’s entire skeleton. There have been no further updates on her expected age and cause of death as the excavation continues.
